intro: Cyclopterygium, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Cyclopterygium species are generally short-lived and have a cosmopolitan distribution. The genus is notable for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and contributing to soil stability.
